Title: For every $\epsilon>0$ there exists $\delta>0$ such that $\int_A|f(x)|\mu(dx) < \epsilon$ whenever $\mu(A) < \delta$
Content:
Hello all mathematicians!! Again, I am struggling with solving the exercises in Lebesgue Integral for preparing the quiz. At this moment, I and my friend are handling this problem, but both of us agreed this problem is a bit tricky.
The problem is following. Let ($X,\mathcal{A},\mu$) be a measure space and suppose $\mu$ is $\sigma$-finite. Suppose $f$ is integrable. Prove that given $\epsilon$ there exist $\delta$ such that $$
\int_A |f(x)|\mu(dx) \;\;<\;\;\epsilon
$$ whenever $\mu(A) < \delta$. Could anybody give some good idea for us? Think you very much for your suggestion in advance.
